verses.verse: Then Jacob<WH3290> lifted<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869> and looked,<WH7200> and behold,<WH2009> Esau<WH6215> was coming,<WH935> and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> with him. So he divided<WH2673> the children<WH3206> among<WH5921> Leah<WH3812> and Rachel<WH7354> and the two<WH8147> maids.<WH8198>
And he put<WH7760> the maids<WH8198> and their children<WH3206> in front,<WH7223> and Leah<WH3812> and her children<WH3206> next,<WH314> and Rachel<WH7354> and Joseph<WH3130> last.<WH314>

But he himself<WH1931> passed<WH5674> on ahead<WH6440> of them and bowed<WH7812> down<WH7812> to the ground<WH776> seven<WH7651> times,<WH6471> until<WH5704> he came<WH5066> near<WH5066> to his brother.<WH251>
Then Esau<WH6215> ran<WH7323> to meet<WH7122> him and embraced<WH2263> him, and fell<WH5307> on his neck<WH6677> and kissed<WH5401> him, and they wept.<WH1058>

And he lifted<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869> and saw<WH7200> the women<WH802> and the children,<WH3206> and said,<WH559> "Who<WH4310> are these<WH428> with you?" So he said,<WH559> "The children<WH3206> whom<WH834> God<WH430> has graciously<WH2603> given<WH2603> your servant.<WH5650>"
Then the maids<WH8198> came<WH5066> near<WH5066> with their children,<WH3206> and they bowed<WH7812> down.<WH7812>

And Leah<WH3812> likewise<WH1571> came<WH5066> near<WH5066> with her children,<WH3206> and they bowed<WH7812> down;<WH7812> and afterward<WH310> Joseph<WH3130> came<WH5066> near<WH5066> with Rachel,<WH7354> and they bowed<WH7812> down.<WH7812>

And he said,<WH559> "What<WH4310> do you mean by all<WH3605> this<WH2088> company<WH4264> which<WH834> I have met<WH6298>?" And he said,<WH559> "To find<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of my lord.<WH113> "
But Esau<WH6215> said,<WH559> "I have<WH3426> plenty,<WH7227> my brother;<WH251> let what<WH834> you have<WH1961> be your own."

And Jacob<WH3290> said,<WH559> "No,<WH408> please,<WH4994> if<WH518> now<WH4994> I have found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in your sight,<WH5869> then take<WH3947> my present<WH4503> from my hand,<WH3027> for I see<WH7200> your face<WH6440> as one sees<WH7200> the face<WH6440> of God,<WH430> and you have received<WH7521> me favorably.<WH7521>

"Please<WH4994> take<WH3947> my gift<WH1293> which<WH834> has been brought<WH935> to you, because<WH3588> God<WH430> has dealt<WH2603> graciously<WH2603> with me, and because<WH3588> I have<WH3426> plenty.<WH3605>" Thus he urged<WH6484> him and he took<WH3947> [it.]
Then Esau said,<WH559> "Let us take<WH5265> our journey<WH5265> and go,<WH1980> and I will go<WH1980> before<WH5048> you."

But he said<WH559> to him, "My lord<WH113> knows<WH3045> that the children<WH3206> are frail<WH7390> and that the flocks<WH6629> and herds<WH1241> which are nursing<WH5763> are a care<WH5921> to me. And if they are driven<WH1849> hard<WH1849> one<WH259> day,<WH3117> all<WH3605> the flocks<WH6629> will die.<WH4191>

"Please<WH4994> let my lord<WH113> pass<WH5674> on before<WH6440> his servant;<WH5650> and I will proceed<WH5095> at my leisure,<WH328> according to the pace<WH7272> of the cattle<WH4399> that are before<WH6440> me and according to the pace<WH7272> of the children,<WH3206> until<WH5704> <WH834> I come<WH935> to my lord<WH113> at Seir.<WH8165>"

And Esau<WH6215> said,<WH559> "Please<WH4994> let me leave<WH3322> with you some<WH4480> of the people<WH5971> who<WH834> are with me." But he said,<WH559> "What<WH4100> need is there? Let me find<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of my lord.<WH113>"
So Esau<WH6215> returned<WH7725> that day<WH3117> on his way<WH1870> to Seir.<WH8165>

And Jacob<WH3290> journeyed<WH5265> to Succoth;<WH5523> and built<WH1129> for himself a house,<WH1004> and made<WH6213> booths<WH5521> for his livestock,<WH4735> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> the place<WH4725> is named<WH7121> <WH8034> Succoth.<WH5523>

Now Jacob<WH3290> came<WH935> safely<WH8003> to the city<WH5892> of Shechem,<WH7927> which<WH834> is in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> when he came<WH935> from Paddan-aram, and camped<WH2583> before<WH6440> the city.<WH5892>

And he bought<WH7069> the piece<WH2513> of land<WH2513> where<WH834> <WH8033> he had pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168> from the hand<WH3027> of the sons<WH1121> of Hamor,<WH2544> Shechem's father, for one hundred<WH1> pieces<WH3967> of money.<WH7192>
Then he erected<WH5324> there<WH8033> an altar,<WH4196> and called<WH7121> it El-Elohe-Israel.
